intro: Epilobium dawbinii, commonly known as the dwarf willow, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the northern hemisphere. Epilobium dawbinii is adapted to cold climates and has a short growing season, with flowering occurring in late spring to early summer. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a component of high-altitude vegetation communities.
